title: How to Unzoom your Apple Watch or Turn off Zoom Completely

steps.title: Double-tap on the watch display to zoom out.
steps.content: Double-tap on the watch display to zoom out. Double-tapping zooms the display in and out. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Double-tap and hold down on the screen with two fingers.
steps.content: Double-tap and hold down on the screen with two fingers. This will allow you to adjust the magnification incrementally by dragging your two fingers.

steps.title: Open Settings on your watch.
steps.content: Open Settings on your watch. The Apple Watch Settings app is a gray circle with a white gear icon inside. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Switch off Zoom.
steps.content: Switch off Zoom. This will completely turn off the Zoom feature on your Apple Watch. Your Apple Watch should be unzoomed, allowing you to get back to using it! You can also close any open apps as needed. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Open the Apple Watch iPhone app.
steps.content: Open the Apple Watch iPhone app. It has a gray and white Apple Watch with a black background. Since your Apple Watch is paired to your iPhone , you can turn off Zoom from the Watch app.

steps.title: Tap My Watch.
steps.content: Tap My Watch . [5] X Research source

steps.title: Switch off Zoom.
steps.content: Switch off Zoom. This will completely turn off the Zoom feature on your Apple Watch.
